news.title: 查尔斯国王首度就安德鲁涉爱泼斯坦案发声
news.title0: King's 'profound concern' as police consider Andrew claims over Epstein
news.content: 查尔斯国王首次就爱泼斯坦案最新爆料表态，称白金汉宫准备支持警方调查其弟安德鲁的指控。
news.content0: King Charles has made his first intervention in the latest round of revelations in the Epstein scandal, saying Buckingham Palace is ready to support the police as they consider allegations against his brother Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 爱泼斯坦案关键人物马克斯韦尔国会听证会上拒答
news.title0: Maxwell refuses to answer questions about Epstein in congressional hearing
news.content: 爱泼斯坦案共犯吉斯莱恩·马克斯韦尔在美国众议院监督委员会听证会上援引第五修正案，拒绝回答问题。
news.content0: Ghislaine Maxwell, the convicted associate of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, refused to answer questions from the US House Oversight Committee on Monday.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 委内瑞拉反对派领袖获释数小时后疑遭绑架
news.title0: Venezuela's opposition says party leader kidnapped hours after being freed
news.content: 委内瑞拉反对派领袖称，其同事胡安·巴勃罗·瓜尼帕获释仅数小时后，在首都加拉加斯被武装人员强行带走。
news.content0: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado said her opposition colleague Juan Pablo Guanipa has been kidnapped just hours after being released from detention.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 美军跨洋追踪并登检一艘违禁油轮
news.title0: US boards tanker in Indian Ocean it 'tracked and hunted' from Caribbean
news.content: 美国军方在印度洋登上一艘油轮，称其从加勒比海被追踪数千英里至此，违反了美国对委内瑞拉石油的制裁封锁。
news.content0: The US military boarded an oil tanker after tracking it for thousands of miles from the Caribbean to the Indian Ocean, the Department of Defense said.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 加拿大矿业公司称其在墨西哥被绑架员工部分遇害
news.title0: Canadian mining firm says its abducted workers found dead in Mexico
news.content: 加拿大矿业公司称，其1月在墨西哥项目现场被绑架的10名员工中，部分已被发现死亡。
news.content0: A Canadian mining company says some of its workers who were abducted from a project site in Mexico last month have been found dead.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 塞内加尔两名名人因涉同性恋指控被捕
news.title0: Two Senegalese Celebrities Are Arrested in Crackdown on Homosexuality
news.content: 塞内加尔一名电视主持人和一名歌手因涉嫌“非自然行为”（指同性性行为）被捕并出庭受审。
news.content0: Two Senegalese celebrities — a TV presenter and a singer — have been arrested and charged with committing “unnatural acts,” a crime referring to gay sex, the police in Senegal said on Sunday.
news.author: NYTimes

news.title: 以色列总统访澳引发抗议与冲突
news.title0: Israeli President’s Visit to Australia Prompts Protests and Arrests
news.content: 以色列总统赫尔佐格访问澳大利亚悉尼，引发抗议活动并与警方发生冲突，抗议者反对其因加沙战争受邀。
news.content0: The arrival of Israel’s president in Australia on Monday to mourn the deaths of 15 people shot at a Hanukkah celebration at Bondi Beach set off protests and clashes in Sydney between the police and activists who had objected to his invitation from Australia’s leader.
news.author: NYTimes

news.title: 美国21岁花滑天才能否重燃国民热情？
news.title0: Can This 21-Year-Old Make America Fall in Love With Figure Skating?
news.content: 21岁的美国花滑选手伊利亚·马利宁被视为冬奥夺金热门，他能否凭借超凡技艺重振美国对花样滑冰的热爱？
news.content0: Years before Ilia Malinin, the world’s most dominant figure skater, felt the smothering G-forces of being a gold medal favorite at the Winter Olympics, he would turn up the music at his rink in Northern Virginia and improvise.
news.author: NYTimes

news.title: 古巴航空燃油耗尽，加航取消赴古航班
news.title0: Air Canada Cancels Flights as Cuba Runs Out of Jet Fuel
news.content: 因古巴政府通知航空燃油耗尽，加拿大航空宣布暂停所有飞往古巴的航班，并将派空机接回滞留旅客。
news.content0: Disruptions to Cuba’s travel industry began Monday after the government notified airlines that it would run out of aviation fuel, part of a crippling energy crisis triggered by the Trump administration’s strict measures, which have largely cut off the communist country’s access to foreign oil.
news.author: NYTimes
